reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the bus and train stations and is surrounded by restaurants, cafes, and shopping. Our room was on the small side but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was nice, as well. Breakfasts were very good and included yogurt, cereals, pastries, etc. My only complaint is the lack of wifi in the room, although the receptionist helped us find a way to get on the internet. The staff was very professional and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Awesome location for boutique style hotel

reviews.text: After reading all the reviews on here I was not sure what to expect. This is what I experienced, from the airport to the main square it is 4 euro (ARST bus straight outside the arrival door). From the bus the hotel is less then 5 mins (walking slow), to the hotel. It is straight behind the Rinascente department door and has a sign pointing you to the right direction. I was greeted by Anna, who I had corresponded with and is also good in speaking english and is very friendly and helpful. There is a a video outside the entrance to the hotel and at the lift (contratry to a previous review that anyone can came & go as they please) , it is clearly marked on the lift to go to the 1st floor to check in. The rooms are all located from the 2 to 4th floor.
reviews.title: Fabulous location for this superior 3 star hotel
BEST HOTEL IN CAGLIARI
reviews.text: I booked a double room for single use, I was given a room on the 4th floor, it was a good size room, clean, bright and a fabulous bathroom which looked new, I was more then pleased. The only downside is that it was at the front which had a good view but did have traffic noise which did cease from about 11am - 7am.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a typical continental selection buffet, there was fresh fruit, apples, pears, bananas plus the food was replenished regularly by the friendly girl who also made coffees to request. It was more then adequate.
reviews.title: Wonderful situation, magnificent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Opposite the hotel is the town hall, if you went out straight infront of you is a bus stop, to the left and walk to Piazza Yenne, (2-3 mins walk) you can get the tour bus which leaves every hour (10 euro), 24hrs using the bus is 3 euros. If you go straight ahead past the department store you are in the main square for the buses and to the left is the train station with the entrance to the port on the right.
reviews.title: We love this city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many, many others, we were forced to extend our holiday when the Icelandic volcano erupted, but the staff at the Due Colonne were exceptionally helpful, allowing use of their own internet facilities and halving the room rate, with no diminution in service or respect - despite our using the room like a laundry, when we ran out of clothes!
reviews.title: Remarkably sympathetic approach under difficult circumstances

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd chosen the hotel on location - one block back from the busy Via Roma, and close to both bus and train stations. Our first room was quiet, with a limited view, but we changed to one on the Largo Carlo Felice, with a view of the sea, and concomitant traffic noise.
reviews.title: perfect for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleaning was extremely efficient and effective, and our teething problems with the air-conditioning unit and television facilities were soon resolved. We missed breakfast one morning, not having observed the notice (clearly displayed in the lift) advising of restricted serving times - but our complaint resulted in coffee being brought to our room.
reviews.title: A good address in Cagliari

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had leisure to reconnoitre other hotels we'd considered, and concluded we'd made the right choice.
reviews.title: Great for public transport and access to restaurants and bars

reviews.text: We stayed one night at Cagliari before flying back home after a trip in Sardinia.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location in pedestrian street, just off Via Roma. Plenty of good restaurants nearby. Large high-ceilinged quiet room. Large bathroom. Good breakfast. Air conditioning noisy but effective.
reviews.title: Good hotel in great location

reviews.text: We booked a junior suite. Room was ok, but not the two separated pieces as mentioned on the booking site. It was rather one large piece
reviews.title: Better bring your own bed

reviews.text: We askef for a baby bed and received a box which we shoud build up ourselves. I presumed this went automatically, but the one click system did not work.
reviews.title: Great hotel, would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I asked the reception for assistance, he couldn't really help me. Too bad
reviews.title: Great service & great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was indeed keeping the street noise outside, so we had a comfortable sleep after all
reviews.title: The perfect boutique hotel
